Module guigame
Package guigame.gui.main

Class GUIGameBoard

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
guigame.gui.panes.GUIPanel
guigame.gui.main.GUIGameBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyboardButtonAdapter, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class GUIGameBoard
extends GUIPanel
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, KeyboardButtonAdapter
A GUIPanel containing the whole GameBoard. It should be shown on a GUIGameBoardWindow. It creates the separate Thread which runs the Ball-Position-update-loop it.
See Also:
GameBoard, GUIGameBoardWindow, Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • GUIGameBoard

      public GUIGameBoard​(GameBoard gameBoard)
      Create a GUIPanel with black background. It will automatically contain a Ball and two Paddles and have the right size.

      Call setParentWindow immediately after this constructor or at least before starting the game to avoid NullPointerException in endBallThread!

      Parameters:
      gameBoard - Game Board to show and to play on
      See Also:
      setParentWindow(guigame.gui.main.GUIGameBoardWindow), NullPointerException, pointOverEndBallThread(guigame.logic.main.Directions)

  • Method Details

    • setParentWindow

      public void setParentWindow​(GUIGameBoardWindow parentWindow)
      Parameters:
      parentWindow - Window to alert if a point is over and a new point should be started

    • paintComponent

      protected void paintComponent​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Paints the whole game board. Invokes super.paintComponent, which paints all previously added. Then paints the line in the center.
      Overrides:
      paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics
      See Also:
      Container.add(Component)

    • startPoint

      public void startPoint​(boolean right, java.awt.Component toRemove)
      Start the game or next point.
      Parameters:
      right - Whether the x-speed should be positive (the ball goes to the right) or negative (object goes to the left).
      toRemove - Component to remove (potentially a button which starts this game)

    • start

      private void start​(boolean right)
      Start the ball thread.
      Parameters:
      right - Whether the x-speed should be positive (the ball goes to the right) or negative (object goes to the left).

    • createBoardObjects

      private void createBoardObjects()
      Create

      - The point labels,

      - The ball and

      - the paddles for the users.

    • createMidLine

      private void createMidLine​(java.awt.Graphics g, int width)
      Create mid line of the game field.
      Parameters:
      g - Graphics to paint on.
      width - Width of mid line.

    • createPointLabels

      private void createPointLabels()
      Create the labels for initial score (0 : 0) and add them to the Game Board GUI. Font size = 20. Y-Offset is 20.

    • updatePointLabels

      public int[] updatePointLabels​(int winningPointPlayer) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Add a point to the GUI for the player who has won the latest point
      Parameters:
      winningPointPlayer - Player which has won the last point
      Returns:
      The new score of both players in an array (to check for a winner??)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the index for the player is out of bounds (0,1)

    • getPointLabels

      private int[] getPointLabels()
      Returns:
      the point labels' texts (so the points)

    • createBall

      private void createBall()
      Creates the ball with a fixed size. Spawns the GUIBall in the middle of the screen.
      See Also:
      Constants.BALL_DIMENSION_SIZE

    • createPaddles

      private void createPaddles()
      Initialize paddles with beginning values (in the center).

    • startBallThread

      private void startBallThread​(boolean right)
      Starts a separate thread for the ball (to move it). This thread is interrupted as soon as the ball exceeds the limit of the game board two times in a row (into the same direction).
      Parameters:
      right - Whether the x-speed should be positive (object goes to the right) or negative (object goes to the left).

    • pointOverEndBallThread

      private void pointOverEndBallThread​(Directions offScreen) throws java.lang.NullPointerException
      Stop the separate thread, uninitialize the ball, set the state to BETWEEN_POINTS and add a point for the person who won the point.
      Parameters:
      offScreen - Into which direction the ball went into the off (why the game was stopped)
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if the parentWindow is not set yet
      See Also:
      ballThread, loop

    • checkForPointEnd

      private Directions checkForPointEnd()
      Checks if the ball goes out of bounds (right or left).
      Returns:
      The Directions into which the ball goes out of bounds.
      See Also:
      Directions, Directions.NONE, Directions.LEFT, Directions.RIGHT

    • checkForCollision

      private void checkForCollision​(Directions outOfBoundsX)
      Check if the ball collides either with top or bottom or with one of the paddles. And react to the potential collision.
      Parameters:
      outOfBoundsX - Direction from checkForPointEnd.
      See Also:
      checkForPointEnd()

    • updatePaddleSpeeds

      public void updatePaddleSpeeds​(int index)
      Update the x- and y-speeds for the paddle at the given index.
      Parameters:
      index - the (0,1) index of the paddle (right or left)

    • moveAIPaddles

      private void moveAIPaddles()
      Moves the paddles automatically if they are artificial intelligence players.
      See Also:
      moveLeftAIPaddle(), moveRightAIPaddle()

    • moveLeftAIPaddle

      private void moveLeftAIPaddle()
      Moves the left paddle since it should be and AI player. Checks for this anyways.
      See Also:
      moveAIPaddles(), moveRightAIPaddle(), Player.isAI()

    • moveRightAIPaddle

      private void moveRightAIPaddle()
      Moves the right paddle if it is and AI player, returns immediately otherwise.
      See Also:
      moveAIPaddles(), moveLeftAIPaddle(), Player.isAI()

    • calculateYBallSpeed

      private float calculateYBallSpeed​(int paddle)
      Calculate the new y-direction speed for the ball based on a GUIUserPaddle it collides with.
      Parameters:
      paddle - Index for the paddle with which the ball collides
      Returns:
      the new ball y-direction speed

    • showGameOverMenu

      private void showGameOverMenu​(int winner)
      Dispose the parent window and show a GameOverMenu.
      Parameters:
      winner - (0-1) The winner's index (left = 0; right = 1)
      See Also:
      GameOverMenu, GUIGameOverMenu, GUIGameOverWindow

    • rightIsHuman

      public boolean rightIsHuman()
      Returns:
      whether there is one human playing

    • getPlayers

      public Players getPlayers()
      Returns:
      The players playing against each other.

    • updateLeftPaddle

      public void updateLeftPaddle​(int paddleLeftYOffset)
      Update the left paddle's y-offset, in the GUI as well as in the logic part.
      Parameters:
      paddleLeftYOffset - The new y-direction offset of the LEFT paddle (AI).
      See Also:
      updateRightPaddle(int)

    • updateRightPaddle

      public void updateRightPaddle​(int paddleRightYOffset)
      Update the right paddle's y-offset, in the GUI as well as in the logic part. This is the user's one if there is a human player.
      Parameters:
      paddleRightYOffset - The new y-direction offset of the RIGHT paddle (from mouse listener or AI).
      See Also:
      updateLeftPaddle(int)

    • getState

      public GameState getState()
      Returns:
      the current GameState
